item.title: Current Project marks
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Marks for the project at the moment are attached below. It includes marks for the schematic simulation, Verilog implementation and PCB design files.
Any concerns must be notified before 29th of April. 

You will get out of 7 marks for the physical PCB where you should bring it at the viva. Also, make sure you implement some LEDs and inputs on a breadboard so that you can demonstrate the functionality of your PCB at the viva. If you don't have breadboards, wires and LEDs you can take them from the lab. You will not get time for fixing components and wires during the viva time and hence bring everything fixed. We will give a power supply to you at the viva.

Please also note that the addition of all marks would be scaled based on individual contribution that is assessed at the viva.

item.title: CO221 Mid marks
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

You CO221 mid marks are attached herewith. If you have any concerns meet Dr. Samarakoon within this week.

Your cumulative marks can be found in http://tesla.ce.pdn.ac.lk/CO221report or http://10.40.18.47/CO221report/

item.title: Viva slots
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Viva time slots are attached. All the group members are supposed to come at the corresponding time and you have to bring the physical PCB. Venue is CE top floor.

This Tuesday (19th April) you do not have any labs any hence, you can use that time for your projects. Etching chemicals and soldering irons are available in the lab and you can ask for them.

item.title: Cumulative lab marks
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

The marks for all the labs are attached herewith. You can also view them at http://tesla.ce.pdn.ac.lk/CO221report

If you have any concerns please let us know before end of the coming week.

item.title: Lab 8 marks
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Lab 8 marks are attached herewith. If you have any concerns please mail me or meet me before 22th of April.

item.title: Lecture tomorrow
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Dr. Dewasurendra's lecture tomorrow (8th April) will be held in seminar room 2

item.title: Lab 7 (Verilog lab) marks
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Lab 7 marks are attached herewith. 
An auto marking script has been used for grading.
Only those which didn't succeed the test cases 100% have been manually checked and given partial marks.
If you have any concerns about your marks please come to me before this Friday.

Those who are marked in colors should come and meet me as soon as possible.

item.title: Project Phase 1
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Project phase1 specification has been uploaded to course main page.

item.title: Lab 07 : Verilog
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

All the groups will have a lab on Verilog on Tuesday 15th March from 1.00pm at CE top floor.
This would be an individual lab. It is recommended to bring the notes on Verilog.

item.title: PCB session and Lab 8
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

On 29th Tuesday you will have a session that will help to make your PCB layout for the project. 
Also have a look at the following videos which explain the process of making a PCB layout in proteus.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tv-Aa-PSoMs

Then on 31st Thursday you will have the lab 8 where you are will have to implement a 4 bit counter. Therefore, read and understand your theory notes on latches and flip-flops before you are coming to the lab.

item.title: Lab 5
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Lab 5 marks have been uploaded in course page. Any concerns please notify before Friday.

item.title: Project design and bill of materials by this Thursday
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

On this Thursday (17th March) at 1.00 pm you will have a session at CE top floor on how to make a Printed Circuit Board (PCB) so that it will help you on the project. 
The attendence on this session is mandotory for everyone.
Further each group must bring their design and the bill of material and get it approved by the instructors after the session.
After approval you can collect the components.

Any question about the project you can always ask in the forum.

item.title: Lab 4 on Thursday
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Please note that Lab 4 tomorrow (11th Feb Thursday) is for group 11-20 (NOT for group 1-10). For group 1-10 lab would be on Tuesday 16th.

item.title: Lab 6
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Lab 6 would be on the simulation software called Proteus. It would be on 25th Feb Thursday @ CE top floor for all groups. No prelab for this lab.

item.title: Feedback on time spent during labs for explanations
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Fill this feedback about the time we spend during each lab for explaining things.
We will change it in next lab based on your choice.

https://feels.pdn.ac.lk/mod/feedback/view.php?id=8492

item.title: Lab 2 Marks
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Lab 2 marks have been released. If you have any concerns notify me before this Friday!

item.title: HDL (Verilog) Sessions
item.description:
by Roshan G. Ragel.  

Dear All,

We will have the following sessions in the coming week on Verilog HDL.

[15-Feb-2016] 11.05 - 12.00 - Seminar Room #1

[18-Feb-2016] 11.05 - 12.00 - Seminar Room #1

[19-Feb-2016] 11.05 - 12.00 - Seminar Room #2

It is part of the CO221 course. You should attend.

item.title: Lab feedback
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Everyone please complete the lab class feedback form on the course page. You should tell the truth so that we can improve the lab classes in the future for your own benefit. Also note that this is anonymous and hence you can tell whatever you want.

item.title: Prelab 4
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Prelab for lab 4 has been uploaded.

item.title: Lab 1 marks
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Lab 1 marks are out. Check the course page.
If you have any concern contact me/meet me before Friday 5th Feb.

item.title: Lab 3
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Prelab for lab 3 has been uploaded. If you have any problems or issues please post on forum.

item.title: First lab for group 11-20
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Group 11-20 please come to the CE top floor tomorrow (21st Jan) sharp at 1.00pm for the first CO221:Digital Design lab. Bring the prelab with you and also go through the uploaded data sheets before coming.

item.title: First lab for group 1-10
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Group 1-10 please come to the CE top floor tomorrow (19th Jan) sharp at 1.00pm for the first CO221: Digital design lab.

You have to bring the prelab with you and it is recommended to go through the uploaded datasheets before coming.

item.title: Data sheets for lab 1
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Logic gates are available in form of Integrated circuit (IC) packages. An example IC containing several NOT gates are shown below.

We are going to use similar ICs in our lab 1. The pinout of these ICs are given in the respective data sheets.  The datasheets of the ICs that we are going to use are uploaded on the course main page. 

It is highly recommended that you go through them for a minutes (no need to understand fully) before you are coming to the lab, so that your life would be easier during the lab.

item.title: Groups for lab classes
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

The group allocation for CO221 labs are attached.

For group 1 to 10 lab would be held on every  Tuesday from 1.00pm onwards
For group 11 to 20 lab would be held on every  Thursday from 1.00pm onwards

You should bring the answers for the prelab when you are coming to the lab. Note that pre-lab must be done by each individual and NOT one per group. Please note that copying prelabs from one another is strictly prohibited.

item.title: Lab 1 : Do the prelab before coming
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

From 19th Tuesday, labs for CO221 would start. Before you are coming to the lab that day you are supposed to complete the prelab. Prelab questions are uploaded on the course page. Bring the answers when you are coming to the lab, to submit.
